WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: For some reason, you are standing on the sun. It's obviously very hot, but the thing you notice most is the sound of you burning up.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a super loud sizzling sound, drowning everything else out. It's ridiculously loud, and hurts your ears more than the sun's heat hurts your skin.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This sound isn't just loud, it's familiar. Finally you place it: onions (ãŠã‚“)!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Your burning body sounds just like sizzling, crispy onions being fried in a pan. Listen close. It's exactly the same! You can almost smell onions too!

humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions were first seen in the early Spring and Autumn Period, from a short horizontal or short vertical or circular in the " mouth " of the word "è¨€", indicating that the sound comes from the mouth.

The word " yin " is derived from the word " yan ". In bronze, " yan " and " yin " are commonly used as components. The ancient books are also connected, "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. Shun Shuo: "Speaking and sounding" means "like sound and sounding". "Lu Ji. Listening to the Words: "It and People Gu Yanya", "Zhuangzi. "Qiwulun" is made "Songyin".

Bronze inscriptions have been used as the original meaning to express the sound. The prince bell: "The sound is long", and it is also used as the name of the person, Yin Gui: "Wang Hu Nei Shi Yin Ling (ming) Yin". See " yan ", " luan ". "Guodian Chu Jian. Laozi Jiaben: "Sheng He Ye of Yin Sheng (Sound)".

"Said Wen": "Sound, sound. Born in the heart, there are knots outside, it is called the sound. Gong Shangjiao Zhengyu, sound; silk, bamboo, gold, stone, earth, leather and wood, sound also. From words contain one. Where the sound is All belong to the sound."
humanum_short_description_en: ancient text " sound " from " word ", " words " in " port in the" plus point, representing the sound out of the mouth.
